name: Paystack for The Events Calendar
author: Paystack

sections.description:
To get started, you can install the Paystack plugin from the plugins page of your WordPress installation by searching for â€œPaystack Gateway for The Events Calendarâ€.

Alternatively, you can download the plugin from this page and follow the instructions on the page to install the plugin. Please be sure to activate the plugin when you have installed it.

â˜ğŸ» Ensure you have installed the Events tickets add-on on your WordPress site before installing the Paystack for The Events Calendar plugin. The Paystack Gateway for The Events Calendar plugin cannot work without Events Tickets.

After you have installed and activated the plugin, you should go to theÂ Event Tickets Plugin SettingsÂ on the menu tab of your WordPress site and click theÂ PaymentsÂ tab. This will show a tab containing all the Payment options on your site. If you have installed the plugin correctly, you should seeÂ PaystackÂ on that list. This is where you canÂ configure the Paystack Plugin. Click Connect to Paystack

Configuring the plugin

Here we will discuss all the settings you’ll find in your Paystack for Events Calendar Plugin and how they should be set to function properly for your plugin.

  1. Enable Paystack:Â Ensure that the Enable Paystack toggle is on so that Paystack can show up on the list of Payment options during checkout
  2. Test Mode/Live Mode:Â Paystack provides test parameters that allow you to simulate a transaction without using real money. If you select â€œTest Modeâ€, Paystack will be using your Test API keys to parse the payments, meaning that the orders processed then will be done with test cards, no real money is exchanged therefore no real value should be delivered.

When you are ready to go live, you can select the â€œLive Modeâ€ option and the corresponding Live API keys.

  1. API keys:Â Kindly follow this link to your Paystack Dashboard SettingsÂ to find your API keys. Copy the right keys and enter them in the right fields in the plugin settings.
  2. Checkout Mode: You can select the Popup or Redirect method to specify how you want the Paystack checkout to be displayed to the customer.
  3. Webhooks:Â  Copy the auto-generated URL and save it as your webhook URL on yourÂ Paystack Dashboard Settings, under the API Keys & WebhookÂ tab.
sections.faq:
How to get your Test and Live API keys?

There are 2 states on your dashboard:Â Live ModeÂ andÂ Test Mode. You’ll see theÂ Test Mode/Live Mode toggleÂ on theÂ top right corner of your dashboard.

If there is no toggle and it’s justÂ Test Mode,Â this means that your Paystack account has not been activated.Â Â Please follow this link to activate your account

When you go to the Settings Page to get your API keys, please note the mode that your dashboard is in, as that will determine the keys that will be displayed. So if the dashboard is onÂ Test Mode,Â you can only see theÂ Test API keysÂ and vice versa.Â To see the other Keys, switch the toggle from one mode to another.

  • First Release

short_description: The Events Calendar provides calendars, ticketing, and powerful WordPress tools to manage your events from start to finish, and with this plugin, you  …
